Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very good location in front of the tram station”
Reviews.Author: Mandy078
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our daughter of 2.5 years, have stayed at Notting Hill hÃ´tel 4 nights in April 2012. The hÃ´tel is brand new, very modern with a nice design. The room was very big and very clean. We were lucky to have the view on the canal. The breakfast was splendid, with fresh orange juice and plenty of choice to start the day in good conditions... The staff was very kind, specially with our little daughter, and it helped us in finding some goods restaurants in the area and booking them for us. We want to thank you the staff for this fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights - great location, very service oriented, room (Deluxe) with all the trimmings - a tad small for two people, but manageable - I will certainly return - great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: nicole v
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel on a very good location. All tram pass so you can go anywhere. Good restaurants nearby, adequate facilities. The price is a bit high, but all hotels are expensive Amsterdan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staf &beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Hagar111
Reviews.Content: Staff very nice and helpful. The room was decorated in modern style with free internet there is a quality espresso machine in the room! Room service is available throughout the day and very tasty. Reasonable location pretty close to the area of â€‹â€‹entertainment and a nice market. We walked everywhere but I'm not sure it's suitable for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: smith1077
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little out the way from the centre, however you do have a tram stop outside the hotel and it is a lovely walk into the centre. The hotel is in walking distance of lovely small squares where lots of restaurants and pavement cafes are located. In my opinion the restaurants in this area are far better value for money and are not designed for the tourists like in the main centre of Dam Square. The hotel itself is how it is listed on the Internet , A lovely boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Frencyrainford
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were furnished to a very high quality. Breakfast a bit pricey at â‚¬20 pre-paid (normally â‚¬22) but the quality was good. Definately one that we intend to return to.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest staff in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: BritChikOhio
Reviews.Content: I was very sick during my stay last month thanks to a bowl of mussels (not in the hotel but a nearby restaurant) and the staff were so kind, sending warm water and plates of dry toast to my room..... they couldn't have been nicer, and they called me often in my room to make sure I was okay. Way above and beyong great service!! Thanks so much - It hasn't put me off coming to my favorite city, or my favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Service, No Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LucyDragon
Reviews.Content: We live in Amsterdam and decided to have a romantic break and chose this hotel. We arrived at 8pm and we were informed we had a free upgrade to a deluxe room which we were very happy with. We arrived to our room slightly confused and wondering how small and cramped the other rooms must be if this is a deluxe! We had dinner in the restaurant which has absolutely no atmosphere and a strange desolate vibe. We decided not to remain downstairs for a drink. The next morning we requested a late check out. We were told if you check out at 6pm you will be charged, so we asked if we could stay till 3 as we checked in so late and she kindly allowed this. When we called down to say we will be 30mins later than this the reception proceeded to argue with us for 15 minutes telling us were in no uncertain terms lying and that we had requested to check out at 6 pm and we will be charged! Utter B/S. Reception snootily advised us if we check out immediately we will not be charged so instead of a nice relaxing afternoon we rushed to check out on time. Once we got downstairs, despite the resolution, the unpleasant lady on duty continued to argue with for another 10 minutes- what a complete waste of time. Never in a million years as a travel and events coordinator have i experienced such a complete lack of service. What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: After leaving central station we decided to walk to the hotel as it was a lovely day and we didn't have much luggage !! it took us about half an hour and was very easy to find, you can get the tram though and its about 10 mins ! The hotel is luxurious and staff very helpful! We enjoyed coming back and resting our legs after a tiring day sightseeing ! The beds are comfy and bathroom immaculate! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, awesome value”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: After a long trip through eastern Europe we ended our month long vacation by taking a night train from Zurich to Amsterdam. It was wonderful to arrive at hotel that was 4**** but not smack on the city center. From the main train station we took the cable car to our hotel (literally drops you 1/4 of a block away) upon arrival our room was ready. We were thrilled to have a modern room that was big by European standards. The bathroom was perfect we had a wonderful rain shower and entry of space. As for the cable tv well don't buy the package that mistakes your brain. You think for 15 euros your getting unlimited movies but that's not the case. It's a few additional channels. But then again your not in europe to watch tv! Spend time out of your room. There's even a self wash saloon a few blocks away. Across the street from there is a wonderful fruit stand. The owner makes fresh hummus and has a great selection of Mediterranean sides. We were so happy to pick up some fresh fruit, olives, hummus, amazing holland Gouda cheese, fresh bread and a bottle of wine! Dont forget to stop by the open market it's just across the bridge about 1/2 block from the hotel. My only issue is upon check out day we went to rent a car and pick up a gazelle bike that we were bringing back to the states. Check out is at 11 and we didn't get back from picking up the bike till after 11. The lady working the front desk was rude and said we had 10 min to pack. I laughed and said, "yeah ok I've been in Europe since Xmas it's going to take longer then 10 min" she was not happy!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: Beverley B
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed here for 3 days to celebrate our wedding anniversary (we should have gone to Budapest but due to bad weather & cancelled flights we selected this hotel) and what a fantastic find. We highly rate the hotel for its decor, boutique style accomodation and extremely helpful staff, they were always pleasant and nothing was to much trouble. They even left a beautiful bottle of wine in our room. Whilst the hotel is not in the centre it is within walking distance, there is a tram stop immediately outside the hotel. An open air market is only a few minutes away as are several shops coffee houses and supermarkets. We were so pleased with the hotel we hope to return in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, well located boutique with terrific service”
Reviews.Author: skip93
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 5 lovely nights in this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a well located, but not touristy setting, close to all museums and desired sites in this astoundingly beautiful city. There is a lovely bar and lounge area and a fun video screen of a roaring fire, which in Amsterdam always warms you up. The staff are all friendly and helpful, bar tender makes great drinks and the food in the intimate restaurant, Londen is excellent. This place will definitely please you if you have an eye for smart design and great details, the bathrooms are fresh and well laid out, all the hallways are bright and quiet and the beds are really comfy with fine linens. I will definitely return here...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “true boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: A small, intimate and personable property, not a chain. Attractive, contemporary design. Paid EUR 150 for a room which i think was a good deal for this kind of hotel. When I asked for another room (top floor rooms have small windows) I was shown to other ones by the friendly lady at reception to choose from. That's customer service. Free coffee, tea and wifi is a good touch. Still some teething problems (property is new)- the light sensor in the bathroom is not very practical if you get up in the middle of the night as you have to wait 5 mins for the light to go off. The solution is to remove the key card from the electricity mains and the problem is solved (reception told me they are replacing the sensors with old-fashioned switches...). Location is good- several trams and walking distance to the Pijp area and Utrechtsestraat which are less touristy but attractive areas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a quiet corner of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Glukija
Reviews.Content: Indeed clean, modern and spacious is what our room could be called. Nice view on the traffic square, great to make pics of the bikes and trams. Friendly staff. Luxurious coffee machine. For the girls : alas no George Clooney..... Because of a birthday, they threw in the free bottle of wine. We ended up in the restaurant, as surrounding ones were full and there was a cold wind blowing. And then we enjoyed the wine. Do not be put off because it is not right in the center, makes it quiet! Trams stopping nearby, which will take you about 1.25 euro to get to the center fast oneway. Would go there again, if they have an nice offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable and not so expensive! The hotel is much nicer than the pictures online!!”
Reviews.Author: KarimZB
Reviews.Content: I loved it in Notting Hill! The rooms are clean, well equipped, everything is brand new and modern. The staff is very friendly and very helpful! We arrived very early and way before our check-in but they managed to check us in since the room wasn't occupied! Its location is very good, but then again everything is so close to everything in Amsterdam. The prices are not too cheap and not too expensive, compared to other hotels in Amsterdam they have great rates; especially that it's a 4 star hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!! It's a shame we stayed there only for one day! (we had already booked an apartment before discovering this hotel which by the way isn't cheaper than the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “the best convinient hotel but not the best location !”
Reviews.Author: deeeb
Reviews.Content: very clean and comfortable hotel way better than other hotels tried in Amsterdwm staff are super friendly they even made me a cake on my birthday little bit far from down town but u can use the tram to reach in 15 min very close to Heinekin Experience

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rickysjeng
Reviews.Content: By entering the hotel, i got that coming home fieling. It's a nice reception and the room was very clean and big enough for amsterdam standerds. The breakfast was simple but good. It was a great stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at booking.com”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaEiko
Reviews.Content: Hotel is brand new, staff is nice and helpful. Right in front of a tram stop.. Just a few stops from Dam Square. Breaksfast a bit expensive. Free wifi. Had a graet stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJ522
Reviews.Content: This hotel was VERY reasonable and was way more then expected inside. I was on a budget and this hotel couldnt have been any better. I spent about 100 euros not even for the worst room and it is more then worth it!! The only maybe downside was that it wasn't very close to downtown but its right beside the Heineken Experience, and in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time away”
Reviews.Author: morley3003
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and we were pleasantly surprised with how good the hotel was. the pictures can only tell half the story. we had a room on the 3rd floor. the view from the room was just overlooking what looked like a residential area, but couldnt complain at that. no noise heard from the trams. the staff we interacted with were great. the meal we had in the hotel restaurant on the 1st night was worth every penny we paid. we opted to not have breakfast in the hotel as we found we would like to sample local eateries for brunch the only downside was in the room. the panels for the room lights. they generate light which is quite bright so the room isnt in total darkness all night. all in all a great new trendy hotel on the outskirts of Amsterdam centre. a short 10 minutes tram journey from the stop outside the hotel door made access to everywhere very easy. will recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish...but with a few downsides”
Reviews.Author: natasha96
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviewers that this is a very hip, stylish hotel..with a few downsides. The motion sensor lights in the bathroom are indeed annoying. And ground floor rooms do indeed smell a bit musty. A hotel this stylish also needs to work on its electrical wiring because all the effort that was put into designing a hip space with clean lines didn't somehow extend to figuring out to minimize the tv/internet/lamp cords. I also second the recommendation of those who said to skip the breakfast and head for a local cafe. There are lots of options a short walk away on Utrechtstraat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Sjurontour
Reviews.Content: I have found a new and very lovely four star hotel in Amsterdam! It is located in the centre, across from the Dutch National Bank! From the hotel there is only a short stroll the the colourful Albert Cuyp Street Market and the interesting Shopping street - Leidsestraat. It has a lovely reception staffed with friendly people, it has a little lounge, a nice bar and a pleasant restaurant. The rooms are nice too with comfortable beds, modern furniture and airco which makes you feel you are at the North Pole! I can really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “design hotel”
Reviews.Author: doktordod
Reviews.Content: It s a nice hotel, where design is really important. Rooms are big and confortable, bathroom is big as well but it could be better ( please, no automatic switch off of the lights in bathroom - or tell it to ur clients!!). Breakfast is not so big but staff is really nice and helpful. From central station you can reach directly the hotel with tram 4 and 24 ( few stops). I think the price is too high ( common problem in Amsterdam...) but for sure you can have anice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- highly recommended .”
Reviews.Author: Nick-ff
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close enough to centre to be able to walk to most places. Very polite friendly staff. Rooms tastefully decorated. Absolutely no criticism at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but odd at times”
Reviews.Author: Orla5
Reviews.Content: The Notting Hill trys very hard but it has a few oddities. A regular business traveller to Amsterdam I've stayed at the hotel a number of times since it opened, each time some little thing leaves me disatisfied. The rooms are superb but the motion detector bathroom light is very irritating. Avoid the basement rooms -- the one I got was a little musty smelling. Definitely avoid rooms on the ground floor as there isn't a door between the ground floor rooms and the foyer....it can be noisy. One huge advanatge is electrical outlets at each bedside table meaning there is no need to crawl under desk etc to power your phone. Great staff, stylish rooms but a few little kinks to iron out

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleToesSweden
Reviews.Content: Very stylish, newly built hotel (as of July 2011.) Lovely, well-designed rooms with all details well-thought out...e.g. little Nespresso machine. Welcoming, helpful staff. Was greeted on a hot day with a cold glass of water... small gestures of a hospitable staff. Great location just outside the famous Amsterdam chaos, but close enough to the action - about a 10 min walk. Tram stop that takes you to the central station right in front of the hotel. Rooms can be pricey ordinarliy but I was able to get a last minute single room for 80 Euros plus tourist tax.

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: BritChikOhio
Reviews.Content: Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable. Your staff, the rooms, the free wifi and the endless supplies of licorice allsorts..... what more could anyone want! Great bed, great sleep, endless hot water and beautful bathrooms, and the Nespresso machine was great! The food at the restaurant was delicious, and 'Roots' restaurant over the road does a great bucket of mussells too! Tram 4 outside to Amsterdam RAI or Centraal Station is very handy to Schipol airport - and the 7 or 10 to the shops was a breeze. I hope the prices don't go up with these reviews.... as I would for sure like to stay again. Late Rooms.com had the best prices for my stay here out of all of them. My room was 216 and it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: NYdodger31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I though we found a gem off the beaten path a little bit, but found on average hotel that was a pricey cab ride away from all the sites and night life. It has a nice reception area and restaurant but that's where it really ends. The first tried to stick us in the basement where is smelled like smoke from outside. Then they moved us to the 4th floor which was basically a shoe box with a weird shaped roof over the bed. The bed was clean and comfortable, just very small. Overall it was a clean decent hotel, just much to far out of the way if you're only spending the weekend there and want to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Zeeuwin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Notting hill Amsterdam and had a room in the basement. A bit surprised first when we had to take the elevator down to the 8th floor but had a nice spaceous room. Good bathroom and great bed. Small windows close to the ceiling looking at the feet and legs at the terras but who needs a hotel view when you can go outside so we closed the curtains. The hotel is very quiet, no streetnoise inside although it is at a budy corner in town. We had some food in the restaurant before we went to the theater and this was really good and well priced. Much better than what you would get in most of the restaurants close to the theaters!. Breakfast is owfully overpriced unless you take the full English breakfast and skip lunch because you eat too much....... We found a nice espresso bar at 5 mins walk with all kinds of croissants and sweets. Parking is a pain, like everywhere in town but they have a vallet service at 35 Euro/24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Coleslaw
Reviews.Content: 1. Customer service was 1st class! Staff provided a warm and genuine welcome on arrival. 2. Decor is modern, elegant and funky! (Fabulous display of vintage suitcases on reception wall!) 3. Room was a good size with vintage/boutique style decor- large luxurious bed, large, spacious bathroom with rain shower feature 4. Ideally located. 10-15 minute (pleasant) walk to Rembrant Square and tram stops nearby

Reviews.Title: “Do Amsterdam in style and quality”
Reviews.Author: hdunnett
Reviews.Content: Stylist hotel with friendly yet professional staff. After staying in other hotels around Amsterdam during one week, this was the best. Will be the one we return to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely part of town”
Reviews.Author: Haroutioun
Reviews.Content: This a wonderful boutique hotel in a quieter part of Amsterdam. Perfect for the seasoned Amsterdam visitor who has little interest in the center (e.g., red light district) but more interested in being near the museums and the galleries and restaurants along the grachtengordel. The hotel itself is simply lovely, especially with the gracious front desk staff (very friendly and helpful). My room was a single and rather small, but comfortable and very clean. This is one of those design hotels that could have focused on design being more functional (by providing more hooks/shelves etc), but definitely nice overall. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cloggirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here one night while he attended a congress. The hotel is in a good location (right next to a tram stop) and only takes a 10 to 15 tram ride from centraal station and less than a 5 min walk to the cannals (keizersgracht etc). We stayed in a delux double (room 118) and we found it to be a very good size with a big bathroom. We had a very nice view and were not bothered by any outside noise. The room was simply, but beautifuly furnished. The bath room was great and the shower was amazing. I felt that the price was very good for the room. There are a few things that were not perfect. You have to use your key to use the lifts (by placing it on a black disc next to the lift doors) Even if the lift was on the ground floor the doors wouldnt open, So you are left by the lift repeatedly touching your key to the disc, not knowing if it was working. There was no mini bar, only a small vending machine. I usually don't purchace things from the mini bar because it is too expensive, but it is nice to have a fridge to store your own water. The bathroom light comes on automatically when you enter . Since the bathroom door is glass, I was woken up at night when my husband went to the toilet. When I was having a shower the light went off (after about 4 to 5 mins), and didn't come back on again until I got out. Not a huge problem, but something to be aware of :) All is all we had a lovely stay at Notting Hill, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Many issues, would have loved to be back but most unhelpful in returning my deposit”
Reviews.Author: tvanheusden1
Reviews.Content: Stay there on the 12th July for one night - paid the hotel cash in full but had to give my debit card to hold a secure deposit for additionals - I have since found out that the hotel is still holding this deposit against my card and it is over 8 days now. I have phoned 3 days in a row and have had no joy in getting my money back. Maybe they need it more than me! Totally unacceptable and a great disappointment !

Reviews.Title: “It was all about the look rather than function”
Reviews.Author: Prodwell
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from 3 cold wet and windy days in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Hotel Notting Hill. With the Hotel Notting Hill it seems that itâ€™s all about the look and not about the function. The building looks good as does the interior as one enters reception and the common areas looks fine with a decent choice of colours. There is only one elevator and it is rather slow and the floor numbers shown do not correspond to the floors one is wanting. We were on the 3rd floor and the number on the panel in the lift showed floor 4, but that was not a major problem just odd. Then one gets to the room itself and this is where our dislike and the feeling that look is more important than the function comes into play. We had booked a â€œTwin Deluxe Roomâ€� and if this was â€œdeluxeâ€� I am so glad we had not chosen a standard room. Our room was number 314 and I think was on the top floor of the building with a small window overlooking the street. The window could not be opened therefor one had to reply upon the air conditioning for any air in the room. Even though the window would not open, was double glazed and on the 3rd floor (well we think it was but with the lift numbering being off I cannot be certain) it is quite noisy with the trams running on the street in front of the building, but this is quite a common problem with Amsterdam. The room was long and very very narrow with barely room to swing the proverbial cat!! There are many things one could say about the room itself but it was itâ€™s size which triggered the dislike. There was a wardrobe (taking up half of the room width) with shelving on one side and hanging space on the other. Well, with 2 bathrobes taking up most of the hanging space and an ironing board and iron taking up most of the rest there really was no room to hang ones clothes. What really got to us was the bathroom, and this is really a case of the designer just not thinking about how many of the fittings could (or rather could not) be used without aggravation. Letâ€™s start with the floor to ceiling glass door. Now, no matter how long one has been with oneâ€™s partner it is very embarrassing not to be able to use the toilet whilst sitting and doing what nature requires (and which rhymes with sitting). Then one needs to use the hand basin, well I have not used a hand basin before where you have to screw or unscrew the piece of the sink that allows the water to drain or prevent it doing so, how stupid is that!!!! There is nowhere to put the bar of soap provided and the mirror unit over the sink is so badly positioned that you continually bang your head on the shelf surrounding the mirror. When taking a shower there is only a very small (totally inadequate) tray on which to put shower gels / shampooâ€™s soaps etc etc. Now whether one uses the large overhead shower head rose or the hand held option water floods under the door of the shower into the bathroom and into the room itself, requiring one to stack towels on the floor to avoid slipping and doing physical damage!!! The only plus factors for us were (a) good free in room Wi-Fi internet and (b) the Nespresso coffee machine. We really would not recommend this Hotel to visitors to Amsterdam, there must be better for the price and whilst it may not look as good it will function better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PenguinPower
Reviews.Content: Judging by the size of the hotel bar (small) and the fact that the bathroom door is transparent this hotel seems to be aiming more for the lone business traveller and couples rather than families/friends on holiday. When we first checked in at about 1700 we were taken to a room in the basement. To the hotel staff member's embarrassment the room was clearly occupied (bag and clothes on chair, bed unmade). She ushered us back to the reception and she confirmed that according to the computer the room was vacant and clean. The only other room available was on the second floor - and we were relieved. The basement room looked dark and gloomy and smelled of stale cigarette smoke. The second floor room was bright, clean, comfortable, free WiFi- everything you could ask for! The service at the front desk is efficient and business like. The bar and 'behind the scene' staff were more friendly and more chatty. The minibar is a vending machine rather than a fridge - with a Mars chocolate bar setting you back Â£2.50!! No water is provided either but you do get a Nespresso machine with a choice of three coffee pods. English tea drinkers may wish to bring their own tea bags. The closest my husband got to a 'real cuppa' was Earl Grey and that was only on day 1. Day 2 -5 was nothing but fruit tea and green tea. We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment on the food. Location wise, it couldn't be better. Tram 4 and 25 stop outside the hotel and go all the way to Centraal Station (10-15 mins max), the metro station is a short walk away. The hotel is very close to the Albert Cyupmarkt. A wonderful place to shop, eat and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: F550M
Reviews.Content: Great location near tram and metro. Walking distance to heineken experience. Nice, clean rooms. Friendly helpful desk. Breakfast is very expensive and not included. Bathrooms have glass doors so a bit wierd if you are sharing with someone other than spouse. We hung a sheet since were sharing with teens. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but service must be improved”
Reviews.Author: Eglevit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new. The rooms are good in size, the shower is really nice. But service needs to be improved. It took us 30 minutes to check out because all personal is unexperienced. They tried to charge us twice for the same breakfast even after a phone call from our travel agent that the breakfast is prepaid. There was no water and no minibar in the room. Also the pillow is so high it is impossible to sleep on it. The location is out of the center but the tramway is just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Design, Good Service, Need some perfection of the last details”
Reviews.Author: BerlinBen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, I love the design of the hotel. The location is also perfect, it is in the centre of Amsterdam but very quiet. The staff of the Front desk is very helpful and friendly. Free wifi in the hotel! The hotel needs some improvement on the details but in a couple of weeks this should be ready. For example, the minibars were not arrived, telephone on the room is not working, the buttons on the elevator are not clear. The decor of the room is very nice and the beds are perfect. We definitely go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be a great hotel, just give them time (3.5 stars)”
Reviews.Author: shoegirlinDE
Reviews.Content: We realized that being a brand new hotel (it opened two days before we arrived), there would be some things they would still be working out, but were rather surprised at some of the 'loose ends' we discovered. Overall, this was a beautiful, stylish place to stay, but it lacked an obvious polish of a hotel that had been around for awhile. The front desk staff was quite young, at times a little disheveled, unsure of protocol and lacking in neighborhood/popular restaurants/parking option knowledge, but were overall pleasant and helpful. This hotel is located away from any major restaurant or bars, which makes for a quieter part of town, but it's still close enough to walk to almost everything. I'll give them a pass on most things they were still working on (i.e. getting mini fridges for the room, fixing the elevators to go to the right floor, buckets of dirty tools laying around), but there were a couple of things that did get to me. One was the wastefulness of the maid staff. They tossed out the open soaps and replaced the towels every day (they also tossed out our personal soap that we had brought). When we realized they did this, we left the 'do not disturb' button on (everything's very modern and electronic) because we didn't need all new everything, but they came in anyway. Minor, but it would be nice to give guests the option to not be so wasteful and to decide when they didn't want someone in their room. The major thing that bothered me is probably more of an American thing, as it has to do with modesty and privacy. The door to the bathroom is completely transparent glass. I've seen a lot of this travelling throughout Europe in the last year, but this is the first time that anyone on the bed had a direct view of the toilet (how romantic) and a door that didn't even close. The door had a handle and latch that looked like it would go into a door frame - but there was no frame there. There was just a three inch gap all the way around and the door just hung a little open. I'm assuming based on the door design that this is something they're still working on, but it was quite off-putting. The room we had faced the street, but was still a nice enough view with the trees and the canal off to the right. The tram stops right in front of the hotel, which is convenient, but sounds like a low roll of thunder every 20 minutes or so. Not overly loud, just surprising at times. The room was a good size, by European standards, and being new, was spectacularly clean. The bed was quite comfortable but I was surprised how awful and lumpy the pillows were. I thought that was something that resulted from wear, but apparently that's how they're purchased. With some more polish in the service, crossing off the outstanding 'to-dos' and doing something about the bathroom doors, this has the potential to be a really great, 4-5 star place to stay. I hope to hear from reviewers about improvements so we might stay here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Notting Hill
HotelInfo.Address: Westeinde 26, Amsterdam 1017 ZP, The Netherlands
